snippet: Sheik Yusef al-Qaradawi, an Egyptian based in Qatar, has been called an extremist by Syrian authorities but has been influential in the uprising.
abstract: Prominent Sunni Muslim cleric Sheik Yusef al-Qaradawi, Egyptian based in Qatar, calls on Muslims around world to help Syrian rebels in embattled town of Qusayr; labels Hezbollah and Iran, which support Syrian government, as enemies of Islam.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Hala Droubi contributed reporting from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

lead_paragraph: Sheik Yusef al-Qaradawi, an Egyptian based in Qatar, has been called an extremist by Syrian authorities but has been influential in the uprising.

headline.seo: Sunni Cleric Urges Muslims to Help Syria Rebels
headline.main: Sunni Cleric Issues Appeal for World’s Muslims to Help Syrian Rebels
headline.print_headline: Sunni Cleric Issues Appeal for World’s Muslims to Help Syrian Rebels

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
